article.paragraph: TheAntigonid dynasty(IPAc-enænˈtɪɡɵnɪd;lang-grc-greἈντιγονίδαι) was a dynasty ofHellenistic periodHellenistickings descended fromAlexander the Great's generalAntigonus I Monophthalmus("the One-eyed").
article.heading: History
article.paragraph: Succeeding theAntipatrid dynastyin much of Macedonia, Antigonus ruled mostly over Asia Minor and northern Syria. His attempts to take control of the whole of Alexander's empire led to his defeat and death at theBattle of Ipsusin 301 BC. Antigonus's sonDemetrius I Poliorcetessurvived the battle, and managed to seize control ofMacedonia (ancient kingdom)Macedonitself a few years later, but eventually lost his throne, dying as a prisoner ofSeleucus I Nicator. After a period of confusion, Demetrius's sonAntigonus II Gonataswas able to establish the family's control over the old Kingdom of Macedon, as well as over most of the Greek city-states, by 276 BC.cite bookJ. SpielvogelJacksonWestern Civilization: Volume I: To 1715Thomson Wadsworth200589–90http://books.google.co.uk/books?id0-534-64603-4
article.heading: Legacy
article.paragraph: It was one of four dynasties established by Alexander's successors, the others being theList of Seleucid rulersSeleucid dynasty,Ptolemaic dynastyandAttalid dynasty. The last scion of the dynasty,Perseus of Macedon, who reigned between 179-168 BC, proved unable to stop the advancing Roman legions and Macedon's defeat at theBattle of Pydnasignaled the end of the dynasty.Encyclopdia Britannica,Antigonid dynasty, 2008, O.Ed. But Perseus failure to deploy his full resources brought about his defeat (168) at Pydna in Macedonia and signaled the end of the dynasty."

Phila was a daughter ofAntipater, and ancestor of all subsequent Antigonid kings of Macedon, exceptAntigonus III Doson, through her sonAntigonus II Gonatas. Antigonus III Doson was descended from the marriage of Demetrius and Ptolemais, who was a daughter of Ptolemy I Soter and mother of Doson's father,Demetrius the Fair, the ephemeral King of Cyrene. Dedameia was a daughter ofAeacides of Epirusand sister ofPyrrhus of EpirusPyrrhus, she had one son, Alexander, by Demetrius. Demetrius had a further two sons, Demetrius the Thin and Corrhagus, the former by an unnamed Illyrian woman, the latter by a woman named Eurydice.Demetrius I Poliorceteswas the first Antigonid king ofMacedon.
